page.title: 04THE GAMEKEEPERS YEAR CONT.
page.content: "Walking up",which is walking in a straight line about forty or fifty yards apart, shooting at any grouse which rise from the heather. The dogs fetch the birds for their masters. The ponyman comes with the{ponies which carry the party's lunch in big wicker baskets. The tenants may wish to have a few days{salmon fishing,}so Mr Reid has to be prepared to advise them where to fish and which{flies}to use. A day's stalking costs a lot of money - usually over Â£100. When a person goes out to shoot a stag, Mr Reid first has to spy out the ground i.e.look through a telescope or a pair of binoculars for a shootable beast,then keeping the stag to windward the pair crawl over rough
